oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Restoration Work on the State Capitol, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1957, Vol. 4 p. 129
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of restoration work on the State Capitol building, January 1957. The Tennessee State Capitol was designed by architect William Strickland, who modeled it after the Greek Ionic temple. The cornerstone was laid on July 4th, 1845 and the building was completed in 1859. Photographer unknown. Photograph used by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1957. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
